fields.name: resourceType
fields.description: The type of the FHIR resource.
fields.note: resourceType must be DocumentReference.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of this document reference.
fields.note: Only current is supported.

binding.description: The status of the document reference.

fields.name: docStatus
fields.description: The status of the underlying document.
fields.note: Only final is supported for provider access. final and amended are supported for system access.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Specifies the particular kind of document referenced.
fields.note:
The type must include a LOINC or a proprietary coding but not both together. Multiple LOINC codings or a single proprietary coding can be provided.

When providing proprietary code system, it should be of format 'https://fhir.cerner.com/<your EHR source id>/codeSet/<code set>' (where code set is Millennium codeset 72). Example: 'https://fhir.cerner.com/ec2458f2-1e24-41c8-b71b-0e701af7583d/codeSet/72'.

binding.description: Specifies the particular kind of document referenced.

terminology.system: http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-NullFlavor (when type doesn't have a LOINC code)

fields.name: category
fields.description: A categorization for the type of document referenced.

binding.description: A categorization for the type of document referenced.

fields.name: subject
fields.description: Who the document is about.
fields.note: Only patient references are supported.

fields.name: author
fields.description: Identifies who is responsible for adding the information to the document.
fields.note: Must contain only Practitioner references with valid millennium ids.  Optional for system access.  For provider access, only a single author can be provided, and it must be the authorized provider.

fields.name: authenticator
fields.description: Which person authenticates that this document is valid.
fields.note: If set, must be a Practitioner reference with valid millennium id. Only supported with system access. Cannot be populated for provider access.

fields.name: content
fields.description: The document and format referenced.
fields.note: Must contain only one entry

fields.name: content.attachment
fields.description: The document or URL of the document along with critical metadata to prove content has integrity.
fields.note: Data and content type must be provided.

fields.name: content.attachment.contentType
fields.description: Identifies the type of the data in the attachment and allows a method to be chosen to interpret or render the data. Includes MIME type parameters such as charset where appropriate.
fields.note: Must be provided. Content Type must include a supported MIME type and character set. The supported values are `application/pdf`, `text/plain;charset=utf-8`, `text/richtext;charset=utf-8`, `text/rtf;charset=utf-8`, `text/html;charset=utf-8`, `application/xml;charset=utf-8`, and `application/xhtml+xml;charset=utf-8`

fields.name: content.attachment.data
fields.description: The actual data of the attachment - a sequence of bytes, base64 encoded.
fields.note: Please refer common issues section for more info.

fields.name: content.attachment.title
fields.description: A label or set of text to display in place of the data.

fields.name: content.attachment.creation
fields.description: The date that the attachment was first created.
fields.note: A time component must be provided with the date.

fields.name: context
fields.description: The clinical context in which the document was prepared.

fields.name: context.encounter
fields.description: Describes the clinical encounter that the document content is associated with.
fields.note: Only a single encounter reference is supported.

fields.name: context.period
fields.description: The time period over which the service that is described by the document was provided.
fields.note: The period.end field is required; the period.start field is optional.  All dates require a time component.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of this document reference.
fields.note: Both current and entered-in-error are supported. If either status or docStatus are updated to "entered-in-error", the document will be treated as a document that was entered in error, regardless of the values of the other fields.

fields.name: docStatus
fields.description: The status of the underlying document.
fields.note: Allowed values for docStatus are: final, amended, and entered-in-error. If either status or docStatus are updated to "entered-in-error", the document will be treated as a document that was entered in error, regardless of the values of the other fields.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Specifies the particular kind of document referenced.
fields.note:
The type must include a LOINC or a proprietary coding but not both together. Multiple LOINC codings or a single proprietary coding can be provided.

When providing proprietary code system, it should be of format 'https://fhir.cerner.com/<your EHR source id>/codeSet/<code set>' (where code set is Millennium code set 72). Example: 'https://fhir.cerner.com/ec2458f2-1e24-41c8-b71b-0e701af7583d/codeSet/72'.

fields.name: subject
fields.description: Who the document is about.
fields.note: The patient has to match the original document.

fields.name: author
fields.description: Identifies who is responsible for adding the information to the document.
fields.note: Must contain only Practitioner references with valid millennium ids.  Optional for system access.  For provider access, only a single author can be provided, and it must be the authorized provider.

fields.name: authenticator
fields.description: Which person authenticates that this document is valid.
fields.note: If set, must be a Practitioner reference with valid millennium id. Only supported with system access. Cannot be populated for provider access.

fields.name: content
fields.description: The document and format referenced.
fields.note: Must contain only one entry

fields.name: content.attachment
fields.description: The document or URL of the document along with critical metadata to prove content has integrity.
fields.note: Data and content type must be provided.

fields.name: content.attachment.contentType
fields.description: Identifies the type of the data in the attachment and allows a method to be chosen to interpret or render the data. Includes MIME type parameters such as charset where appropriate.
fields.note: Must be provided. Content Type must include a supported MIME type and character set. The supported values are `application/pdf`, `text/rtf;charset=utf-8`, `text/html;charset=utf-8`, `application/xml;charset=utf-8`, and `application/xhtml+xml;charset=utf-8`

fields.name: content.attachment.data
fields.description: The actual data of the attachment - a sequence of bytes, base64 encoded.
fields.note: Please refer common issues section for more info.

fields.name: content.attachment.title
fields.description: A label or set of text to display in place of the data.

fields.name: content.attachment.creation
fields.description: The date that the attachment was first created.
fields.note: A time component must be provided with the date. The new date must not be earlier than the previous content.attachment.creation date.

fields.name: context
fields.description: The clinical context in which the document was prepared.

fields.name: context.encounter
fields.description: Describes the clinical encounter that the document content is associated with.
fields.note: The encounter has to match the original document encounter.

fields.name: context.period
fields.description: The time period over which the service that is described by the document was provided.
fields.note: The period.end field is required; the period.start field is optional.  All dates require a time component.
